cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.category: Tropical Depression (forecast to become Tropical Storm/Hurricane)
cyclone.current_location: about 420 miles SSW of Apalachicola, Florida

motion.direction: W (expected to turn N then NNE)

cyclone.trajectory: Expected to turn north-northeast, make landfall along Florida’s Big Bend Thursday, then cross GA/SC and re-emerge over the Atlantic, tracking northeast just off the U.S. East Coast toward the Mid-Atlantic and New England.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend between Anclote River and Indian Pass

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch: Anclote River to Indian Pass, FL.  Tropical Storm Watch: West of Indian Pass to Walton/Bay County line, FL.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Gulf Coast, then entire southeast U.S. coast from northern Florida through the Carolinas, eventually Mid-Atlantic and southern New England coasts.
weather_observation.wind: Small (10%) chance of tropical-storm-force winds late Saturday into Sunday; otherwise breezy with gusts 25-35 kt possible.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected above 3 ft; minor coastal inundation possible along Delaware Bay at high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches of rain possible as the system passes offshore this weekend.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf, dangerous rip currents, and minor coastal flooding could disrupt port operations.
